info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 5:48AM EDT until April 8 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Cleveland OH has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio...
Scioto River Near Prospect affecting Marion and Delaware Counties.
For the Scioto River...including Larue, Prospect...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Scioto River near Prospect.
* WHEN...From this morning to late Tuesday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Long stretches of both River Road and Route 257 are flooded in northwest Deleware county, from near Route 36 to the Marion County line.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 13.8 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.8 feet on 03/14/1939.
- Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/cle.
The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 400 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE TUESDAY EVENING
